values: Dear White People, Why is it that when you guys get tazered it's considered "excessive force" but when a black man gets shot 51 times it's "routine"? WAKE UP, PEOPLE!!! Kind regards, Yo Momma

About that guy who paid someone to shoot him in the foot so he wouldn't have to go back to Iraq...I'm surprised stuff like this hasn't happened sooner and a lot more often.  As someone who is related to a soldier who has served 3 tours in Iraq, each lasting approximately a year I volunteer to shoot any soldier anywhere he or she wishes to keep them from going back over there.  The military does not offer proper counceling services when these service men and women return home and a lot of them are very young, fresh off Mommy's tit and don't know how to function much less how to cope with the sites and sounds of war.

If you're going to call someone a hero you should treat them like one...not continue to pay these boys and girls (which many of them are) below the poverty line and ship them off to war and smack them in the ass when they come back.  As much as we'd like to think they are, these kids are not machines void of feelings.  America can't compare to the Middle East as far as soldier preparation...those kids over there learn to shoot a gun at 3, they are taught in the womb to do whatever it takes to defend their country...we had to be drafted and enticed with sign-on bonuses and offers to pay for college.

So I say, God bless you if you have chosen to serve in the military and didn't know what you were getting in to.  I used to think that soldiers shouldn't complain about going to war because that's a hazard of the job but the more I think about it and the more I think about how much of a fucktard Bush is, I can't help but feel sorry for these people who are honorably serving their country being led by the stupidest fucker who has ever walked the earth.

To all my LJ Friends and the Strangers who wonder through.... If that doesn't come out, go HERE *photo taken by my other half* I know some of you go on hiatus during this time of the year...visiting family, laying low, getting right for the New Year, etc...so I wanted to catch you all before you went your respective ways to wish you and your families (even the dysfunctional drunk uncle who touches everyone innapropriately) a very happy holiday season and if you don't celebrate any holidays than happy Thursday and keep it movin.

Did anyone catch MAD TV this past weekend?  Specifically, the skit where they had Maury and Connie's All-Star Christmas and their guests were Joy Behar and the pig from Charlotte's Web...well, smack in the middle of the skit, the camera pans down and the pig is pooping all over the rug...next thing you know it starts peeing too!  It was hilarious.

I know nothing about DJ equipment or turntables or stereo's...would anyone like to volunteer to help me find a moderately priced turntable with whatever accessories I need to hear the record or a good stereo system that can be connected to a TV.  I've been reading different sites but I don't understand all that technical crap.

HELP!

So, those of you who have been around a few years know that I am NOT a fan of this Thanksgiving crap but if you are into Pilgrims and land theft and nasty ass turkey and all like that, ENJOY. *insert cynical smile* I like to think that I am thankful everyday for my blessings and I have dinner with my family (when we're all together) whenever I can. I guess I'm grateful for the two days off of work every year and with Black Friday, all the neighbors go out early so it's pretty quiet in the morning. lol We're getting paroled at 3pm so I'm just counting down to quitting time at this point. Yesterday I had a checklist of what I wanted to accomplish and EVERYONE under the sun interrupted me. Today it's quiet and I'm almost done with the whole list. Of course I won't finish the whole thing cause I don't want to overdo it. I'll run some errands (post office, bank, supermarket) on my way home and then I'll straighten up the house a bit since I'll be home for 4 days...don't want to sit around in a rat trap
In case you know someone who is interested, please pass along... The Call Me MISTER program is contributing to the talent pool of excellent black male teachers...
Doogie Howser is NOT gay. I don't care that he did come out. Are there any men in Hollywood that aren't gay, rumored to be gay or bi? Seriously?

Dear World, I have revoked 's black card for the day...she said she doesn't like grits. I'll give it back to her tomorrow but she's on probation. Carry on. A Concerned Citizen EDIT TO ADD: I've had a caucus with the black contingency and there's only one person willing to give her a pass for being from up north so unfortunately, majority ruled and the revocation took effect at 11:05am. I also met with the white people and it seems they love their grits too so they don't want her either...poor . NEWSFLASH - THIS JUST IN - 's dislikation of grits has been downgraded to code yellow and her revocation has been upgraded to a warning...the reason? We've just found what is "allegedly" a black woman who...DOESN'T LIKE FRIED CHICKEN! Once we confirm the race of said woman we will revoke her black card indefinitely, make her get a jehri curl and send her to live out the rest of her days in Upper Mongolia. We now return you to your regulary scheduled program.

OK, I've stopped working for the day...I'm going on strike for the rest of the day. I'm having a mini sit-in at my desk. DAMN THE MAN! Who's with me?! What time is it? 2pm? Oh, wait, I need to go on a strike break...they're having cake for all the July birthdays in the department! I'll be back. *raises fist*

What would you say (in four words or less) to completely deter someone on the first date from going on a second one, or ever seeing you again?


example:
"I'm really a man." or "I'm currently unemployed."
(conjunctions count as one word)



your turn...

MONOLOGUE: Oprah has her favorite things episode every year for Christmas and gives all kind of stuff away. I am not Oprah, although I have been in the same room with her and exchanged a sisterly nod of acknowledgement which I will treasure for the rest of my life...anyway...I can't give you guys anything but I can share all my secret favorite things. Whenever I find something new I'll try to hook ya'll up! #1...this has been on my radar for over a year now but I'm not sure most people know they exist. If you're like me you're a complete germ-a-phobe who changes their towels everytime the wind shifts, disinfects the house if people even look in your window (airborne bacteria!) and you have a separate cutting board for cheese, meat, chicken, fish and veggies. Well, no need for all those bacteria infected cutting boards. Saran makes disposable cutting boards! #2...Since we're in the kitchen, T-Fal makes cookware with a Thermo-Spot. It's a heat indicator to let you know when your pot is hot enough to start cooking in. They also have ergonomically designed handles with little vents you can open instead of leaving the lid cracked and having spillage all over your stove! #3...Globe Trekker is a series where they tape some random travelers making their way through a country. It's shown on PBS and they're awesome!!! A lot of them go way off the beaten path and you get more than a travel guide, you get a lesson in culture, foods, etc. #4...LUSH Cosmetics has been on my radar for 7 years but with the opening of the NY store a few years ago all of my bathing fantasies came true. I absolutely love their bath bombs and the karma soaps are to die for. When I lived in London I used their face masks cause I was able to refrigerate them right away. I loved them. #5...surprise.com offers gift idead for pretty much every occasion you can think of (and some you would never think to buy a gift for. It has a gazzillion categories like dog walker, runner, has a bad back, wrestling fan, etc...the ideas range from the traditional to completely out of the box. Next time you're stumped for what to buy that special someone or just that person who invited you to their party and you feel obligated to go even though you secretly despise them, suprise.com can help you out. Well, there you have it. My first ever favorite things list. Enjoy...List #2 coming sometime in the future...stay tuned.

Three 6 Mafia STEALS Oscar Song Award Why couldn't they have just WON an Oscar like everyone else did? Why did they STEAL it? Dear Yahoo, Stop fueling my militant fires. Power to the people *raises fist* Laura-ski Milya, did they get your system up and running? You at lunch? Where'd you go?! haha

Dear 5 o'clock, Where are you hiding? I know you're around here somewhere. I can see you peaking out from behind 4:59. It's ok, come on out...no, seriously, come out...no, really...COME THE FUCK OUT! Many thanks. Laura ummm...I don't want to alarm anyone but the file folders on my desk just moved...like that after you put something down and it settles type move only I haven't touched them all day. See? Even the spirits that haunt the office want me to go home. I hope I don't have to have my finger amputated...it hurts like hell and it's turning the most awful shade of purple. It's not Prince *licks her fingers and bugs out her eyes* purple, it's more like like bruise purple. Ouch! Where's E.T. when you need him? This is one of very few public posts...I don't know why I'm making it public, I just am. Make it work...carry on...

That is my mantra for today...it's so funny how life works...you take 10 steps ahead and fall back 20. I'm just in a not so happy place today. I'm sure it'll pass and I'm not quite sure how I got here...I'm not exactly sad, not really mad, not happy, not confused, not annoyed, not pissed...I'm indifferent. I don't really feel anything today. What an odd feeling. It's like waiting for the other shoe to drop...waiting...waiting...waiting...waiting... So I decided that I don't want to talk to Shawn so I sent her an email and told her she'd have to wait until the weekend or send me an email. I am NOT trying to "repair" a friendship with my anytime minutes or over the phone. She needs to man up and ask me to meet her somewhere or come to my house. I don't respect her as it is...it would be in her best interest to go through the proper channels. Now, don't get me wrong...that in no way means I'm ready to make peace with her...I'm just ready to get down with the cutting off in person. Who knows, I may crack under pressure. I don't know what will happen, I guess that depends on what she has to say. I may go wild ape woman on her and rip her hair out of her scalp or I could just say "fuck off" and walk away...hell, I could give her a hug and then just never call her again. I don't like where this could go. I remembered my glasses today so I'm actually going to get some work done! I may also be able to catch up on some of your LJ's. We have a staff meeting this afternoon and I'm not looking forward to it. Hopefully it'll be a short one. I was supposed to be in new hire orientation for 2 days (today and tomorrow) so this was REALLY going to be a short week but it got canceled so I have to wait until next month...I WON'T BE NEW ANYMORE!!! HELLO! haha I blow dryed my hair last night and I'm having a good hair day...I wish I could freeze my hair like this. This guy just moved to the desk behind me and his phone has this obnoxious ravesque ring tone (we can change our ringers on our office phone). I think his phone rings every 5 minutes...HOW ANNOYING! Pugmeister is here today...staring at me from over our wall...WHAT?!

Hey party people...things are hectic right now...we have to pack all our lovely belongings and get set for the move (January 21st)...plus, I have a MAJOR job interview tomorrow morning so I'm sort of nervous (wish me luck).  I'm getting set to go up to my Mom's for the night (wish HER luck).  

I'll give a full report tomorrow when I get back.  

PS - We were lucky and got an apartment in the building next door to the one we moved from (same landlord)...it's the IDENTICAL apartment we moved from just in the next building so we know all our crap's going to fit  YEAH!!

Well, I have to pack...happy holidays and I really do miss you all!  I swear!

So last night we're laying in the bed watching the news and they were talking about this article in National Geographic Traveler about Philly being the "next big city" and the anchor is standing there leading into the story and then says "Go on Philly, brush your shoulders off..." and proceeds to do the brushing motion on his shoulder. We both looked at each other sideways...I was like "did he just..." and before I could finish my sentance we both started cracking up so hard our sides hurt. Dr. Dave, Your ghetto pass has been revoked...brush that off, Negro. What the fuck were you thinking dropping ghettoisms in the middle of a serious news story. Now the white folk are gonna stop watch the Fox29 10 o'clock news and we can't have that cause we have bills to pay so quit the shenanigans and just deliver the news, buster. Holla! Concerned Viewers

Am I the only person on the face of the earth who just doesn't get Gwen Stefani? I think she dresses like a homeless person and sorry but she just can't sing. She's not very attractive either. I was flipping radio stations while we were out and about this weekend and they're playing her on the hip hop stations here in NY...WHY?! I think I've lost all faith in today's popular music and will go back to my old school QUALITY music.

Welcome to my jounral...this is friend's only...if you'd like to be let in the club, respond to this and we'll see if you're on the list.

Peace and love.
The Queen
